Pre-Game Insights: Ghana are favourites given their experience and quality in the squad.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ghana have won the Africa Cup of Nations in four of their first seven appearances (1963, 1965, 1978, 1982) but have won none of their subsequent 16.
Cape Verde have never lost their opening match at a CAF Africa Cup of Nations (W1 D2)
Others: Mohammed Kudus was directly involved in 50% of Ghana’s goals in the qualifiers for this year’s tournament, scoring three times and assisting one (4/8).

If André Ayew plays, this will be his eighth CAF Africa Cup of Nations, which will equal the record held by Cameroon’s Rigobert Song and Egypt’s Ahmed Hassan. Meanwhile, if he scores for Ghana, he will set a new record of having found the net in seven different AFCON tournaments.
